huntYears.SEASON_DATE_TEXT: During open seasons on any 2022 South Slope Antlerless Elk hunt - See the 2022 Antlerless Guidebook for details
huntYears.NOTES:
Hunters who obtain a South Slope Antlerless Elk conservation permit may hunt the following areas/seasons:
South Slope, Diamond Mtn: Oct 31 - Nov 8, 2022 and Nov 14 - Nov 22, 2022 and Nov 28 - Dec 6, 2022
South Slope, Yellowstone: Oct 8 - Oct 20, 2022 and Nov 2 - Nov 10, 2022 and Nov 19 - Nov 27, 2022 and Dec 10 - Dec 31, 2022 and Jan 14 - Jan 31, 2023
South Slope, Bonanza/Vernal: Aug 20 - Sept 21, 2022 and Oct 8 - Oct 20, 2022
South Slope, Mosby Mtn: Nov 12, 2022 - Jan 8, 2023
South Slope, Buckskin Hills-Jensen: Dec 3 - Dec 31, 2022 and Jan 2 - Jan 31, 2023

huntMaster.SPECIAL_INSTRUCTIONS: Any open antlerless elk units in the guidebook that include South Slope in the unit name
huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Voluntary: Hunters who obtain this permit are encouraged, but not required, to submit a harvest report. Report your harvest online or by calling 1-800-221-0659.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: 65% Public land-BLM and State lands.  35% Private lands enrolled in Diamond Mountain Landowner Association.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds near this unit are managed by the US Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the public lands including wildlife management areas. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their website.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/ashley/home
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Vernal and Dutch John topo maps or BLM version equivalent that shows land ownership.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Most roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service, BLM, or DWR and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. There is no off-road vehicle use allowed on DWR lands except on established roads and trails.
Ashley National Forest: http://www.fs.usda.gov/detail/ashley/home/?cid=STELPRDB5432815
BLM: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html Most areas are closed to off road vehicle use except on designated routes.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The boundary of this hunt unit does not include Tribal Trust Lands, but does have private land included.  There is private property on Diamond Mountain.  You should receive written permission from the landowner before hunting on private property.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett and Uintah counties--Boundary begins at the Utah-Colorado state line and the Green River at Browns Park; west along this river to Gorge Creek; south along Gorge Creek to the USFS/private land boundary at the head of Davenport Draw; south along the USFS/private land boundary on the west side of Davenport Draw to the BLM boundary; south along the BLM boundary approximately one-third of a mile to the rim of Diamond Mountain; south and easterly along this rim until the rim intersects the Diamond Mountain road (Jones Hole Road); south and west on this road to the Brush Creek road; south on this road to the Island Park/Rainbow Park road; east on this road to the Dinosaur National Monument boundary; north and east on this boundary to the Utah-Colorado state line; north on this state line to the Green River. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public lands are all Forest Service lands managed by the Ashley and Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forests.  This unit includes a large portion of the High Uintas Wilderness Area where all motor vehicles are prohibited.  This unit also includes large tracts of Ute tribal lands that are closed to non-tribal members.  The tribal lands are mostly the lower elevation sagebrush zone but in some areas they reach up into the aspen/conifer zone.  There is a large amount of private property on the unit too.  Most of the private property is below the tribal boundary but there are several parcels of private property in the canyon bottoms.
huntBoundaryInfos.WMA_IN_UNIT: Little Montes Creek WMA north of Ballard and Kevin Conway WMA southeast of Myton.  Elk, bear and cougar are rarely found on these WMAs.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the forest. There are special restrictions on camping and campfires in certain areas within the Wilderness area. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
Ashley National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
Uinta-Wasatch-Cache National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/uwcnf
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIM_ACCESS_PTS: The main access points for the High Uintas Wilderness include: Uinta Canyon Trailhead, West Fork of Whiterocks Trailhead, Chepeta Trailhead, Lake Fork Trailhead, Yellowstone/Swift Creek Trailhead, Jackson Park road, Dry Gulch road, Rock Creek Trailhead, North Fork of Duchesne Trailhead, and Grandview trailheads
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Kings Peak and Duchesne topo maps
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and are covered on their Travel Management Plans. Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service. Maps can also be purchased online at:http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The hunt unit does not include the Ute tribal lands.  There is a large tract of Ute tribal trust land that stretches east to west across the South Slope of the Uinta Mountains.  Road access across the tribal land is permitted only across the main access roads to the Forest.  All ATVs are prohibited on tribal Lands, they must be trailered on access roads across tribal Lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Duchesne, Summit, Uintah and Wasatch counties—Boundary begins at SR-87 and US-40 in Duchesne; north on SR-87 to SR-35; northwest on SR-35 to the Provo River; north along this river to North Fork Provo River; north along this river to SR-150; east and north on SR-150 to the Summit-Duchesne county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains) at Hayden Pass; east along the summit of the Uinta Mountains to the Dry Fork-Whiterocks drainage divide; south atop this divide to USFS Trail #025; southwest on this trail to Whiterocks Lake and the East Fork of the Whiterocks River; south along this river to the Whiterocks River; south along this river to the Uinta River; south along this river to the Duchesne River; west along this river to US-40 at Myton; west on US-40 to SR-87 in Duchesne. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LAND WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Duchesne, Dutch John, Kings Peak, Provo, Salt Lake City, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call the Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Public, Private and Tribal Lands.  The public lands include US Forest Service lands managed by the Ashley National Forest and BLM lands.  The Tribal lands are mostly the lower elevation sagebrush areas.  There is a large amount of private property on the unit too.
huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO:
All Campgrounds on this unit are managed by the US National Forest Service. Camping outside of official campgrounds is also permitted on most of the Forest. Please direct all questions regarding campground availability and other camping questions to the US Forest Service or BLM. Maps and camping regulations are available on their websites.
Ashley National Forest website: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
Vernal BLM website: http://www.blm.gov/ut/st/en/fo/vernal.html
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: USGS 1:100,000 Dutch John, Vernal, Seep Ridge Topo maps or BLM version equivalent that indentifies land ownership.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
Travel management on Forest Service and BLM lands in this unit is regulated through federal travel management plans which address road and trail restrictions including use of ATVs. Current information on these travel management plans and maps can be obtained from the Forest Service Ashley National Forest office (435) 789-1181 and Vernal BLM office (435) 781-4400.
Maps can also be purchased online at: http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: The hunt unit does not include Ute Tribal lands as shown on the hunt boundary map on the Division's website.  There is a large tract of Ute Tribal Trust Land that stretches east to west across the South Slope of the Uinta’s.  Road access across the Tribal land is permitted only across the main access roads to the Forest.  All ATVs are prohibited on Tribal lands they must be trailered on access roads across Tribal Lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Daggett, Duchesne and Uintah counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Colorado state line and the White River; west along this river to the Green River; north along this river to the Duchesne River; north along this river to the Uinta River; north along this river to Whiterocks river; north along this river to the East Fork of the Whiterocks River; north along this river to Whiterocks Lake and USFS Trail #025; northeast on this trail to the Dry Fork-Whiterocks drainage divide; north atop this divide to the Daggett-Uintah county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains); east along the summit of the Uinta Mountains to US-191; north on US-191 to Cart Creek; north along this creek to Flaming Gorge Reservoir; east along the south shoreline of Flaming Gorge Reservoir to the Green River; east along this river to Gorge Creek; south along Gorge Creek to the USFS/private land boundary at the head of Davenport Draw; south along the USFS/private land boundary on the west side of Davenport Draw to the BLM boundary; south along the BLM boundary approximately one-third of a mile to the rim of Diamond Mountain; south and easterly along this rim until the rim intersects the Diamond Mountain road (Jones Hole Road); southwest on this road to Brush Creek road; south on this road to Island Park road; east on this road to Dinosaur National Monument Boundary; northeast on this monument boundary to the Utah-Colorado state line; south on this state line to the White River. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John, Kings Peak, Seep Ridge, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

huntBoundaryInfos.LAND_OWNERSHIP: Land Ownership:  Public, Private and Ute Tribal Lands.  The public lands are all US Forest Service lands managed by the Ashley National Forest.  There is no hunting or trespassing on Ute Tribal Lands.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
ATV and Vehicle Access: 
All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the US Forest Service and BLM,  and are covered on their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the US Forest Service, and BLM. Maps can also be purchased online at:  http://www.fs.usda.gov/ashley
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Duchesne and Uintah counties--Boundary begins at SR-121 and the Uintah River; north along this river to Whiterocks river; north along this river to the East Fork of the Whiterocks River; north along this river to Whiterocks Lake and USFS Trail 025; northeast on this trail to the Dry Fork-Whiterocks drainage divide; north atop this divide to the Daggett-Uintah county line (summit of the Uinta Mountains); east along this summit to Hacking Lake road USFS 043; south on this road to the Red Cloud Loop road USFS 018; South west on this road to the Dry Fork Canyon road; southeast on this road to SR-121; west on SR-121 to the Uintah River. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John, Kings Peak,Vernal. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.

Uintah County—Boundary begins at the USFS southern boundary and the Uinta River; southeast along this river to the Duchesne River; south along the Duchesne River including a 1 mile buffer on the west side of the Duchesne river to the Green River near Ouray; northeast along the Green River including a 1 mile buffer on the east side of the Green River to Hwy 40; east on Hwy 40 to the Utah/Colorado border; north along the border to Harpers Corner Road; north and west along Harpers Corner Road to the Dinosaur National Monument boundary; south and west along this boundary to where Hwy 149 crosses the Green River; west along the Green River to Hwy 149 again and the Dinosaur National Monument boundary; north and east on Dinosaur National Monument boundary to the Island Park road; west on this road to the Brush Creek road; north on this road to the Diamond Mountain road; north on this road to the Diamond Mountain rim; west along this rim to the USFS boundary; west on this boundary to the Uinta River. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Hunters should acquire written permission from the landowner before applying for this hunt. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. Excludes all National Monument lands.  USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Dutch John, Vernal. Boundary questions? Call Vernal office, 435-781-9453.
